MEDICARE COMPLIANCE OFFICER
BASIC FUNCTION
The Medicare Compliance Officer is responsible for general oversight of all activities related to the Medicare lines of business at Farm Bureau Health Plans. The Medicare Compliance Officer is responsible for developing, implementing and monitoring the Medicare Compliance Program to ensure compliance with all applicable rules and regulations relating to the Company's Medicare operations. The Medicare Compliance Officer will ensure auditing and monitoring activities are performed to satisfactory standards of quality in a timely fashion. With strong organizational skills, the Medicare Compliance Officer assists the Vice President of Compliance in achieving goals and objectives; identifies and resolves a variety of regulatory issues; and is responsible for the development, implementation, and oversight of the auditing and monitoring processes.

The ICO focuses on all compliance issues related to both “gaming” and “non-gaming” topics occurring onsite. The ICO is responsible for the oversight of compliance activities in accordance with Federal, State and Local regulations including the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), SMC Anti-Money Laundering (AML) program, the USA Patriot Act (Patriot Act), CO Gaming ACT, CO ICMPs and related requirements.
This hands-on role is responsible for implementing and monitoring compliance programs that are in line with current industry best practices, regulatory guidance and requirements. Reporting to the General Manager and Senior Vice President of Compliance, this role will be responsible for ensuring accurate and timely filing of regulatory reports (e.g., ICO audits, Currency Transaction Reports, Suspicious Activity Reports, and other required reports as deemed necessary). It will also be responsible for ensuring transaction monitoring is implemented for the purpose of identifying unusual activity including any patterns and trends.

This person will work closely on the executive team, to create internal policies that are clear and concise and ensure proper, effective communication and training of policies and regulations across all departments and employees. ABOUT SANITAS:
Sanitas originated in Colombia in the 1980s and then ventured into Venezuela, Peru, Brazil and Mexico in 1994. With our success in those countries, we then expanded to South America and the United States in 2014. Our patient volume in the United States is approximately 200,000 and we currently service the Florida, Texas, New Jersey and Connecticut markets and plan to continue to scale into other markets.

PURPOSE
To oversee, manage, and advise on compliance and governance matters for the global entity.
To coordinate the successful completion of external certification activities including PCI DSS Level 1 and SOC 2 Type II.
To maintain up-to-date expertise of the security standards, laws, and regulations applicable to all jurisdictions within which the global entity or its clients operate.
To utilize gained knowledge to advise global and regional leadership on compliance-impacting business decisions, processes, and implementations.
To facilitate interdepartmental and international communication and collaboration to implement organizational controls for compliance initiatives.

About us
Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. In 2020, Lendistry provided Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans to small businesses in all 50 states and was selected by the State of California to administer the California Small Business COVID-19 Relief Grant Program, which distributed grants to the small businesses that lost significant revenues during the pandemic. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

With Omaha roots but regional and national assets, City+Ventures owns and operates a wide array of businesses, including automotive dealerships; carwashes; a private jet management and charter company; real estate management; and construction-related businesses, in addition to holding a real estate portfolio. In August 2020, City+Ventures’ proven track record of reinvention and financial success earned it the No. 71 spot on the Inc. 5000 Company list.

Summary:

Supporting City Ventures’ healthcare division – headquartered in Omaha, NE, with national operations - the Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer will build, execute, and maintain compliance excellence for our healthcare businesses. This role is responsible for ensuring company compliance with all federal and local laws and regulations, especially those in the healthcare industry. This person will work closely on the executive team, to create internal policies that are clear and concise and ensure proper, effective communication and training of policies and regulations across all departments and employees. The incumbent will be expected to build the department and processes, audit, keep up with changes to laws and regulations that may affect the company, and proactively develop action plans to ensure compliance at all times.

With operations spanning the US, the Chief Compliance Officer will need to be aware of an array of state and local laws. The incumbent of this position should have the ability to keep pace with a rapidly expanding company in an ever-changing legislative landscape.

Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

Founded in 1985, SelectQuote provides solutions that help consumers protect their most valuable assets: their families, health and property. The company pioneered the model of providing unbiased comparisons from multiple, highly rated insurance companies allowing consumers to choose the policy and terms that best meet their unique needs. Two foundational pillars underpin SelectQuote's success: a strong force of highly trained and skilled agents, who provide consultative needs analysis for every consumer, and proprietary technology that sources and routes high-quality leads. About us
Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. In 2020, Lendistry provided Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans to small businesses in all 50 states and was selected by the State of California to administer the California Small Business COVID-19 Relief Grant Program, which distributed grants to the small businesses that lost significant revenues during the pandemic. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

Develop and review company policies.
Advise management on the company’s compliance with laws and regulations through detailed reports.

NSA Overview NSA's mission is to help protect national security by providing policy makers and military commanders with the intelligence information they need to do their jobs. In order to ensure that operations occur within the established laws, authorities, policies and directives, NSA has built a robust compliance office and program to meet this goal. Do you want to help protect national security by ensuring operations occur in a compliant manner? If so, a Compliance Officer job may be right for you! Compliance Officers develop and implement comprehensive mission compliance solutions to keep NSA's activities consistent with the laws, policies, and procedures designed to protect privacy during mission operations. They support the development, implementation, and monitoring of a mission compliance program that includes internal control activities, risk assessments, standards and procedures, awareness and training, and verification and assessment to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Description of the Position The responsibilities of a Compliance Officer include: - Ensuring compliance with laws, legal codes, practices, documents, precedents, court procedures, executive orders, government organization/functions - Completing compliance auditing, monitoring, and verification activities (interviewing, planning, developing) - Using investigative techniques, laws, directives and applying investigative standards, policies and procedures necessary to make competent investigative determinations - Serving as a liaison between groups internal or external to the Agency - Identifying a need for and knowing where or how to gather information - Managing compliance incidents or processes, perform root cause analysis and develop mitigation strategies

About us
Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. In 2020, Lendistry provided Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans to small businesses in all 50 states and was selected by the State of California to administer the California Small Business COVID-19 Relief Grant Program, which distributed grants to the small businesses that lost significant revenues during the pandemic. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

NSA Overview NSA's mission is to help protect national security by providing policy makers and military commanders with the intelligence information they need to do their jobs. In order to ensure that operations occur within the established laws, authorities, policies and directives, NSA has built a robust compliance office and program to meet this goal. Do you want to help protect national security by ensuring operations occur in a compliant manner? If so, a Compliance Officer job may be right for you! Compliance Officers develop and implement comprehensive mission compliance solutions to keep NSA's activities consistent with the laws, policies, and procedures designed to protect privacy during mission operations. They support the development, implementation, and monitoring of a mission compliance program that includes internal control activities, risk assessments, standards and procedures, awareness and training, and verification and assessment to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Description of the Position The responsibilities of a Compliance Officer include: - Ensuring compliance with laws, legal codes, practices, documents, precedents, court procedures, executive orders, government organization/functions - Completing compliance auditing, monitoring, and verification activities (interviewing, planning, developing) - Using investigative techniques, laws, directives and applying investigative standards, policies and procedures necessary to make competent investigative determinations - Serving as a liaison between groups internal or external to the Agency - Identifying a need for and knowing where or how to gather information - Managing compliance incidents or processes, perform root cause analysis and develop mitigation strategies

Job Title: Compliance Officer - Financial Crime Anti- Money Laundering & Tax
Job Description:
#LI-TL1 #HSBCUSA
As a Compliance Officer on our Financial Crime – Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Tax Transparency Program and Policy Team, and reporting directly to the US Head of AML and Tax Transparency, you will provide risk stewardship relating to the specific financial crime threats the firm faces now and in the future, contributing to processes and frameworks that protect our business, our customers, and the many communities in which we operate, from the harms associated with financial crime. The AML and Tax Transparency Program and Policy team is responsible for oversight and risk stewardship of the AML and Tax Transparency programs at HSBC in the US. We coordinate policy and program changes across all of our businesses, liaise with our counterparts at the Global level and provide subject matter expertise to all lines of business and functions on AML and Tax Transparency issues. The team is responsible for Policy changes, serves as a thought leader in public debate regarding proposed changes in the regulatory compliance landscape, leads bank initiatives relating to new and changing AML and Tax Transparency regulatory requirements, advises businesses regarding regulatory changes, and partners with other functions within Financial Crime (FC), including Investigations, Risk and Analysis, and the Lines of Business FC teams, to support our businesses and coordinate oversight of risks and controls across the organization.

The CCO reports directly to the Chief Executive Officer. She/He must also inform the Board about important issues and material violations.
CCO Duties and Responsibilities:
Design, implement and enforce company-wide compliance programs to ensure compliance with the company Code of Conduct and all applicable U.S. laws, rules, and regulations

As a Compliance Officer on our Financial Crime – Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Tax Transparency Program and Policy Team, and reporting directly to the US Head of AML and Tax Transparency, you will provide risk stewardship relating to the specific financial crime threats the firm faces now and in the future, contributing to processes and frameworks that protect our business, our customers, and the many communities in which we operate, from the harms associated with financial crime. The AML and Tax Transparency Program and Policy team is responsible for oversight and risk stewardship of the AML and Tax Transparency programs at HSBC in the US. We coordinate policy and program changes across all of our businesses, liaise with our counterparts at the Global level and provide subject matter expertise to all lines of business and functions on AML and Tax Transparency issues. The team is responsible for Policy changes, serves as a thought leader in public debate regarding proposed changes in the regulatory compliance landscape, leads bank initiatives relating to new and changing AML and Tax Transparency regulatory requirements, advises businesses regarding regulatory changes, and partners with other functions within Financial Crime (FC), including Investigations, Risk and Analysis, and the Lines of Business FC teams, to support our businesses and coordinate oversight of risks and controls across the organization.

Job Description Summary
The GE Digital Chief Compliance Officer will have responsibility for managing GE Digital’s compliance and ethics programs and oversight of the group’s enterprise risk management (ERM) program. This role requires strategic vision and superb execution skills to deliver, simple effective and audit-ready compliance processes for both culture and core risk areas and to influence executives and employees to manage and mitigate broad enterprise risks.

Director of Consumer Compliance - (210000EH)
Description

The Director of Consumer Compliance is responsible for the continued successful operation of the bank’s Compliance Management System, providing oversight of its continued development, implementation and administration. The incumbent leads a team of regulatory compliance specialists primarily responsible for maintaining the company’s framework for compliance risk management, and provides strategic direction designed to support organizational growth, leadership and day-to-day management. This senior leadership position manages the support provided to all applicable areas of the bank in order to ensure compliance with federal and state consumer protection laws and regulations.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may also be assigned.

Role:
The VP Chief Compliance Officer will be an integral part of the Senior Management Team and responsible for the credit union's overall compliance, audit and vendor management programs. The VP Chief Compliance Officer will manage and implement the daily operations, compliance, audit and vendor management programs to ensure that the credit union is compliant with all applicable laws and regulations. The VP Chief Compliance Officer will be the liaison for all audits and regulatory examinations as well as be the internal resource for the Credit Union staff regarding all compliance related questions and issues. The VP Chief Compliance Officer will keep up to date on all relevant regulations and maintain the CU's Policies and Procedures to keep current with all changes.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities:

Summary
Our Firm's clientele is global by nature and complicated. As such, we require additional compliance professionals that have the appropriate experience and depth of knowledge of this global landscape.
The Compliance Officer will be part of the compliance team and will focus on all aspects of compliance, including Corporate, Consumer Protection and, most importantly, KYC/AML. The ideal candidate will have experience in compliance within the financial services industry. Candidates from Payments Firms, Money Services Businesses, and Traditional/Retail Banks will have the most suitable background.

NSA Overview NSA's mission is to help protect national security by providing policy makers and military commanders with the intelligence information they need to do their jobs. In order to ensure that operations occur within the established laws, authorities, policies and directives, NSA has built a robust compliance office and program to meet this goal. Do you want to help protect national security by ensuring operations occur in a compliant manner? If so, a Compliance Officer job may be right for you! Compliance Officers develop and implement comprehensive mission compliance solutions to keep NSA's activities consistent with the laws, policies, and procedures designed to protect privacy during mission operations. They support the development, implementation, and monitoring of a mission compliance program that includes internal control activities, risk assessments, standards and procedures, awareness and training, and verification and assessment to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Description of the Position The responsibilities of a Compliance Officer include: - Ensuring compliance with laws, legal codes, practices, documents, precedents, court procedures, executive orders, government organization/functions - Completing compliance auditing, monitoring, and verification activities (interviewing, planning, developing) - Using investigative techniques, laws, directives and applying investigative standards, policies and procedures necessary to make competent investigative determinations - Serving as a liaison between groups internal or external to the Agency - Identifying a need for and knowing where or how to gather information - Managing compliance incidents or processes, perform root cause analysis and develop mitigation strategies

Job Title: Compliance Officer - Financial Crime Anti- Money Laundering & Tax
Job Description:
#LI-TL1 #HSBCUSA
As a Compliance Officer on our Financial Crime – Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Tax Transparency Program and Policy Team, and reporting directly to the US Head of AML and Tax Transparency, you will provide risk stewardship relating to the specific financial crime threats the firm faces now and in the future, contributing to processes and frameworks that protect our business, our customers, and the many communities in which we operate, from the harms associated with financial crime. The AML and Tax Transparency Program and Policy team is responsible for oversight and risk stewardship of the AML and Tax Transparency programs at HSBC in the US. We coordinate policy and program changes across all of our businesses, liaise with our counterparts at the Global level and provide subject matter expertise to all lines of business and functions on AML and Tax Transparency issues. The team is responsible for Policy changes, serves as a thought leader in public debate regarding proposed changes in the regulatory compliance landscape, leads bank initiatives relating to new and changing AML and Tax Transparency regulatory requirements, advises businesses regarding regulatory changes, and partners with other functions within Financial Crime (FC), including Investigations, Risk and Analysis, and the Lines of Business FC teams, to support our businesses and coordinate oversight of risks and controls across the organization.

#LI-TL1 #HSBCUSA
As a Compliance Officer on our Financial Crime – Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Tax Transparency Program and Policy Team, and reporting directly to the US Head of AML and Tax Transparency, you will provide risk stewardship relating to the specific financial crime threats the firm faces now and in the future, contributing to processes and frameworks that protect our business, our customers, and the many communities in which we operate, from the harms associated with financial crime. The AML and Tax Transparency Program and Policy team is responsible for oversight and risk stewardship of the AML and Tax Transparency programs at HSBC in the US. We coordinate policy and program changes across all of our businesses, liaise with our counterparts at the Global level and provide subject matter expertise to all lines of business and functions on AML and Tax Transparency issues. The team is responsible for Policy changes, serves as a thought leader in public debate regarding proposed changes in the regulatory compliance landscape, leads bank initiatives relating to new and changing AML and Tax Transparency regulatory requirements, advises businesses regarding regulatory changes, and partners with other functions within Financial Crime (FC), including Investigations, Risk and Analysis, and the Lines of Business FC teams, to support our businesses and coordinate oversight of risks and controls across the organization.

NSA Overview NSA's mission is to help protect national security by providing policy makers and military commanders with the intelligence information they need to do their jobs. In order to ensure that operations occur within the established laws, authorities, policies and directives, NSA has built a robust compliance office and program to meet this goal. Do you want to help protect national security by ensuring operations occur in a compliant manner? If so, a Compliance Officer job may be right for you! Compliance Officers develop and implement comprehensive mission compliance solutions to keep NSA's activities consistent with the laws, policies, and procedures designed to protect privacy during mission operations. They support the development, implementation, and monitoring of a mission compliance program that includes internal control activities, risk assessments, standards and procedures, awareness and training, and verification and assessment to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Description of the Position The responsibilities of a Compliance Officer include: - Ensuring compliance with laws, legal codes, practices, documents, precedents, court procedures, executive orders, government organization/functions - Completing compliance auditing, monitoring, and verification activities (interviewing, planning, developing) - Using investigative techniques, laws, directives and applying investigative standards, policies and procedures necessary to make competent investigative determinations - Serving as a liaison between groups internal or external to the Agency - Identifying a need for and knowing where or how to gather information - Managing compliance incidents or processes, perform root cause analysis and develop mitigation strategies

NSA Overview NSA's mission is to help protect national security by providing policy makers and military commanders with the intelligence information they need to do their jobs. In order to ensure that operations occur within the established laws, authorities, policies and directives, NSA has built a robust compliance office and program to meet this goal. Do you want to help protect national security by ensuring operations occur in a compliant manner? If so, a Compliance Officer job may be right for you! Compliance Officers develop and implement comprehensive mission compliance solutions to keep NSA's activities consistent with the laws, policies, and procedures designed to protect privacy during mission operations. They support the development, implementation, and monitoring of a mission compliance program that includes internal control activities, risk assessments, standards and procedures, awareness and training, and verification and assessment to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Description of the Position The responsibilities of a Compliance Officer include: - Ensuring compliance with laws, legal codes, practices, documents, precedents, court procedures, executive orders, government organization/functions - Completing compliance auditing, monitoring, and verification activities (interviewing, planning, developing) - Using investigative techniques, laws, directives and applying investigative standards, policies and procedures necessary to make competent investigative determinations - Serving as a liaison between groups internal or external to the Agency - Identifying a need for and knowing where or how to gather information - Managing compliance incidents or processes, perform root cause analysis and develop mitigation strategies

Job Title: Compliance Officer - Financial Crime Anti- Money Laundering & Tax
Job Description:
#LI-TL1 #HSBCUSA
As a Compliance Officer on our Financial Crime – Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Tax Transparency Program and Policy Team, and reporting directly to the US Head of AML and Tax Transparency, you will provide risk stewardship relating to the specific financial crime threats the firm faces now and in the future, contributing to processes and frameworks that protect our business, our customers, and the many communities in which we operate, from the harms associated with financial crime. The AML and Tax Transparency Program and Policy team is responsible for oversight and risk stewardship of the AML and Tax Transparency programs at HSBC in the US. We coordinate policy and program changes across all of our businesses, liaise with our counterparts at the Global level and provide subject matter expertise to all lines of business and functions on AML and Tax Transparency issues. The team is responsible for Policy changes, serves as a thought leader in public debate regarding proposed changes in the regulatory compliance landscape, leads bank initiatives relating to new and changing AML and Tax Transparency regulatory requirements, advises businesses regarding regulatory changes, and partners with other functions within Financial Crime (FC), including Investigations, Risk and Analysis, and the Lines of Business FC teams, to support our businesses and coordinate oversight of risks and controls across the organization.

About the Company:

City+Ventures is a premier development and investment company focused on building companies and communities. With Omaha roots but regional and national assets, City+Ventures owns and operates a wide array of businesses, including automotive dealerships; carwashes; a private jet management and charter company; real estate management; and construction-related businesses, in addition to holding a real estate portfolio. In August 2020, City+Ventures’ proven track record of reinvention and financial success earned it the No. 71 spot on the Inc. 5000 Company list.

Summary:

Supporting City Ventures’ healthcare division – headquartered in Omaha, NE, with national operations - the Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer will build, execute, and maintain compliance excellence for our healthcare businesses. This newly created position will be a key position within our executive team. This role is responsible for the development of a comprehensive enterprise privacy, compliance, and risk management program. This position may be remote for individuals willing to travel up to 30%.

This role is responsible for ensuring company compliance with all federal and local laws and regulations, especially those in the healthcare industry. This person will work closely on the executive team, to create internal policies that are clear and concise and ensure proper, effective communication and training of policies and regulations across all departments and employees. The incumbent will be expected to build the department and processes, audit, keep up with changes to laws and regulations that may affect the company, and proactively develop action plans to ensure compliance at all times.

With operations spanning the US, the Chief Compliance Officer will need to be aware of an array of state and local laws. The incumbent of this position should have the ability to keep pace with a rapidly expanding company in an ever-changing legislative landscape.


Why work for City Ventures?

Summary
Our Firm's clientele is global by nature and complicated. As such, we require additional compliance professionals that have the appropriate experience and depth of knowledge of this global landscape.
The Compliance Officer will be part of the compliance team and will focus on all aspects of compliance, including Corporate, Consumer Protection and, most importantly, KYC/AML. The ideal candidate will have experience in compliance within the financial services industry. Candidates from Payments Firms, Money Services Businesses, and Traditional/Retail Banks will have the most suitable background.
Essential Functions.

About us
Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. In 2020, Lendistry provided Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans to small businesses in all 50 states and was selected by the State of California to administer the California Small Business COVID-19 Relief Grant Program, which distributed grants to the small businesses that lost significant revenues during the pandemic. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

Position Summary:
The Energy Ethics and Compliance Officer is responsible for implementing the Bechtel companywide ethics and compliance program and related compliance activities within the Energy Global Business Unit (GBU) and implements and refines the GBU compliance and ethics strategy.

Providing employees with prospective decision-making guidance and answering questions concerning the Bechtel standards of conduct;

PURPOSE
To oversee, manage, and advise on compliance and governance matters for the global entity.
To coordinate the successful completion of external certification activities including PCI DSS Level 1 and SOC 2 Type II.

To facilitate interdepartmental and international communication and collaboration to implement organizational controls for compliance initiatives.

ISC’s Financial Services Recruitment team is partnering with a leading and highly ranked Investment firm with a strong presence on the West Coast. The organization is a leader in the Multi-Family Office space and known for their exceptional client service and fiduciary approach. They pride themselves on being a highly collaborative team with a low turnover, excellent benefits, and competitive full package. They’re a group of passionate & driven professionals looking for someone to lead their Compliance Department.

Founded in 2008, Hightower is a wealth management firm that provides investment, financial and retirement planning services to individuals, foundations, and family offices, as well as 401(k) consulting and cash management services to corporations. With over $100B AUM, Hightower’s capital solutions, operational support services, size and scale empower its vibrant community of independent-minded wealth advisors to grow their businesses and help their clients achieve their vision of “well-th. rebalanced.” Based in Chicago with advisors across the U.S., the firm operates as a registered investment advisor (RIA).

Role & Responsibilities

We are seeking an experienced Chief Compliance Officer (“CCO”) who is a multi-tasker at heart, with strong communication skills and a problem-solving mindset that thrives in a fast-paced and evolving organization. Our ideal candidate consistently performs at a high level under variable workloads and has ability to form strong relationships across the firm. In this senior leadership role, the CCO is primarily responsible for overseeing compliance within the organization and ensuring compliance with laws, regulatory requirements, policies, and procedures. As the compliance leader and subject matter expert, the CCO is responsible for establishing standards and implementing procedures to ensure that the compliance programs throughout the organization are effective and efficient in identifying, preventing, detecting, and correcting noncompliance with applicable laws and regulations for multiple investment advisors, private funds, products, investment management, and a broker dealer. This position reports to the Chief Operating Officer and Head of Enterprise Protection and will have frequent interactions with executive leadership across the firm.


Required Competencies

Experience & Qualifications

Serves as a function/business/product compliance risk officer for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM) responsible for assisting with internal strategies, policies, procedures, processes, and programs to prevent violations of law, rule, or regulation and design and deliver a risk management framework that maintains risk levels within the firm's risk appetite and protect the franchise. In addition, engages with the ICRM Product and Function coverage teams, in order to partner to develop and apply CRM program solutions that meet the function/business/product and customer needs in a manner consistent with the Citi program framework. Primary responsibilities include monitoring compliance risk behaviors and providing day-to-day Compliance advice relating to the supported function/business/product and guidance on function/business/product rules/laws and interpretation on internal policies and procedures
.
Key activities include:
Compliance and Control
Product Compliance Risk Management

Job Title: Compliance Testing Officer - Financial Crimes - VP
Job Description:
Serves as a compliance risk officer for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM)’s Financial Crime Testing team responsible
for leading reviews to assess compliance with laws, rules and regulations and corresponding Citi policies primarily through substantive testing.
The Compliance Testing VP assesses compliance risks and controls implemented by the first and second line of defense. Also responsible for performing risk assessments of Citi's compliance risks; performing independent testing activities (testing and on-going monitoring) to assess the design and effectiveness of key controls designed to address compliance risk; reporting and escalating control issues and any violations of laws or breaches of policy; and validating adequacy of remediation taken to address reported issues.

Compliance and Control
Assurance

Director of Consumer Compliance - (210000EH)
Description

The Director of Consumer Compliance is responsible for the continued successful operation of the bank’s Compliance Management System, providing oversight of its continued development, implementation and administration. The incumbent leads a team of regulatory compliance specialists primarily responsible for maintaining the company’s framework for compliance risk management, and provides strategic direction designed to support organizational growth, leadership and day-to-day management. This senior leadership position manages the support provided to all applicable areas of the bank in order to ensure compliance with federal and state consumer protection laws and regulations.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may also be assigned.

Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer - Healthcare Division

About the Company:

City+Ventures is a premier development and investment company focused on building companies and communities. With Omaha roots but regional and national assets, City+Ventures owns and operates a wide array of businesses, including automotive dealerships; carwashes; a private jet management and charter company; real estate management; and construction-related businesses, in addition to holding a real estate portfolio. In August 2020, City+Ventures’ proven track record of reinvention and financial success earned it the No. 71 spot on the Inc. 5000 Company list.

Summary:

Supporting City Ventures’ healthcare division – headquartered in Omaha, NE, with national operations - the Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer will build, execute, and maintain compliance excellence for our healthcare businesses. This newly created position will be a key position within our executive team. This role is responsible for the development of a comprehensive enterprise privacy, compliance, and risk management program. This position may be remote for individuals willing to travel up to 30%.

This role is responsible for ensuring company compliance with all federal and local laws and regulations, especially those in the healthcare industry. This person will work closely on the executive team, to create internal policies that are clear and concise and ensure proper, effective communication and training of policies and regulations across all departments and employees. The incumbent will be expected to build the department and processes, audit, keep up with changes to laws and regulations that may affect the company, and proactively develop action plans to ensure compliance at all times.

With operations spanning the US, the Chief Compliance Officer will need to be aware of an array of state and local laws. The incumbent of this position should have the ability to keep pace with a rapidly expanding company in an ever-changing legislative landscape.


Why work for City Ventures?

Role:
The VP Chief Compliance Officer will be an integral part of the Senior Management Team and responsible for the credit union's overall compliance, audit and vendor management programs. The VP Chief Compliance Officer will manage and implement the daily operations, compliance, audit and vendor management programs to ensure that the credit union is compliant with all applicable laws and regulations. The VP Chief Compliance Officer will be the liaison for all audits and regulatory examinations as well as be the internal resource for the Credit Union staff regarding all compliance related questions and issues. The VP Chief Compliance Officer will keep up to date on all relevant regulations and maintain the CU's Policies and Procedures to keep current with all changes.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities:

Summary
Our Firm's clientele is global by nature and complicated. As such, we require additional compliance professionals that have the appropriate experience and depth of knowledge of this global landscape.
The Compliance Officer will be part of the compliance team and will focus on all aspects of compliance, including Corporate, Consumer Protection and, most importantly, KYC/AML. The ideal candidate will have experience in compliance within the financial services industry. Candidates from Payments Firms, Money Services Businesses, and Traditional/Retail Banks will have the most suitable background.
Essential Functions.

About us
Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. In 2020, Lendistry provided Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans to small businesses in all 50 states and was selected by the State of California to administer the California Small Business COVID-19 Relief Grant Program, which distributed grants to the small businesses that lost significant revenues during the pandemic. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.
As part of Freddie Mac’s return to the office pilot, all employees, contingent workers and visitors must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to be on-site unless they have an approved accommodation.
Position Overview:
The Senior Director of Compliance is responsible for establishing and maintaining the compliance risk management for the Freddie Mac Charter, Fair Lending and other consumer protection regulations, including oversight of third parties such as sellers and servicers. The role spans Freddie Mac’s major operating Divisions - Single Family, Multi Family, Investments & Capital Markets, as well as the other divisions as they pertain to the regulatory areas. Review Alliance is seeking experienced Bank Compliance Officers interested in working with community banks as a Virtual Compliance Officer. Successful candidates will review transactions for compliance with banking regulations and is responsible for completing reviews in the areas of compliance and making recommendations for corrections and/or improvements of internal control system, policies and regulatory procedure. Review Alliance is a part of Bankers Alliance (B/A), which is the holding company for Compliance Alliance as well as Review Alliance. Job Title: Senior Compliance Officer, First Line Monitoring & Testing
Job Description:
Address:
111 W Monroe - 115 S LaSalle

Business Management
Supports the business/group leader in the effective implementation, maintenance and administration of first line of defense (1st LOD) compliance program, including overseeing business operations within the jurisdiction to ensure adherence and efficiency. Contributes to a strong risk management culture through collaboration with other first line employees, and second & third line functions to ensure Compliance risks are identified, mitigated, monitored, tested and reported on an ongoing basis.

The Company:
Merit is a fast growing, pioneering financial services firm that invests heavily in the growth and development of team members. Merit seeks to establish, educate, and help individuals reach their financial goals as they transition into and experience retirement. With an unswerving commitment to excellence and reliability, Merit provides objective financial advice and believes in establishing long-lasting relationships. By offering an array of services, clients can receive tailored solutions that are aimed at promoting growth and help them work toward their financial goals.
Merit believes in addressing the retirement challenges in America by helping clients reach financial freedom and confidence to the working population and retirees alike. This focus on comprehensive financial wellness enables us to deliver the ultimate client experience.

We are actively searching for a motivated and experienced compliance officer to guarantee that our business processes and transactions follow all relevant legal and internal guidelines. Your duties will include reviewing employee work, developing company policies, and responding to policy violations.
The ideal candidate will be professional, highly analytical, and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. To prosper in this role, you should be fluent in risk management and our industry’s principles.
Responsibilities:
Implement and manage an effective legal compliance program.
Develop and review company policies.
Advise management on the company’s compliance with laws and regulations through detailed reports.

PURPOSE
To oversee, manage, and advise on compliance and governance matters for the global entity.

To utilize gained knowledge to advise global and regional leadership on compliance-impacting business decisions, processes, and implementations.
To facilitate interdepartmental and international communication and collaboration to implement organizational controls for compliance initiatives.

About the Company:

City+Ventures is a premier development and investment company focused on building companies and communities. With Omaha roots but regional and national assets, City+Ventures owns and operates a wide array of businesses, including automotive dealerships; carwashes; a private jet management and charter company; real estate management; and construction-related businesses, in addition to holding a real estate portfolio. In August 2020, City+Ventures’ proven track record of reinvention and financial success earned it the No. 71 spot on the Inc. 5000 Company list.

Summary:

Supporting City Ventures’ healthcare division – headquartered in Omaha, NE, with national operations - the Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer will build, execute, and maintain compliance excellence for our healthcare businesses. This newly created position will be a key position within our executive team. This role is responsible for the development of a comprehensive enterprise privacy, compliance, and risk management program. This position may be remote for individuals willing to travel up to 30%.

This role is responsible for ensuring company compliance with all federal and local laws and regulations, especially those in the healthcare industry. This person will work closely on the executive team, to create internal policies that are clear and concise and ensure proper, effective communication and training of policies and regulations across all departments and employees. The incumbent will be expected to build the department and processes, audit, keep up with changes to laws and regulations that may affect the company, and proactively develop action plans to ensure compliance at all times.

With operations spanning the US, the Chief Compliance Officer will need to be aware of an array of state and local laws. The incumbent of this position should have the ability to keep pace with a rapidly expanding company in an ever-changing legislative landscape.

Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

Assists in the implementation, maintenance and administration of a specific compliance program. Works with business/group and internal partners to ensure regulatory, corporate and fiduciary obligations are met. Job Title: Senior Compliance Officer - Consumer Banking Compliance Risk Assessments
Job Description:
Serves as a senior Global Consumer Bank (GCB) Product Compliance risk officer for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM) responsible for establishing internal strategies, policies, procedures, processes, and programs to prevent violations of law, rule, or regulation and design and deliver a risk management framework that maintains risk levels within the firm's risk appetite and protect the franchise. In addition, engages with the ICRM product and function coverage teams, to partner, develop and apply Compliance Risk Management program solutions that meet the Global Consumer Bank business and customer needs in a manner consistent with the Citi program framework. Primary responsibilities include monitoring compliance risk behaviors, providing day-to-day Compliance advice relating to operations, financial requirements, and guidance on the Global Consumer Bank business and the associated regulatory rules/laws and interpretation on internal policies and procedures.
Responsibilities:
Compliance and Control
Compliance Risk Management

We are actively searching for a motivated and experienced compliance officer to guarantee that our business processes and transactions follow all relevant legal and internal guidelines. Your duties will include reviewing employee work, developing company policies, and responding to policy violations.
The ideal candidate will be professional, highly analytical, and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. To prosper in this role, you should be fluent in risk management and our industry’s principles.
Responsibilities:
Implement and manage an effective legal compliance program.
Develop and review company policies.
Advise management on the company’s compliance with laws and regulations through detailed reports.

PURPOSE
To oversee, manage, and advise on compliance and governance matters for the global entity.
To coordinate the successful completion of external certification activities including PCI DSS Level 1 and SOC 2 Type II.
To maintain up-to-date expertise of the security standards, laws, and regulations applicable to all jurisdictions within which the global entity or its clients operate.
To utilize gained knowledge to advise global and regional leadership on compliance-impacting business decisions, processes, and implementations.
To facilitate interdepartmental and international communication and collaboration to implement organizational controls for compliance initiatives.

Founded in 2008, Hightower is a wealth management firm that provides investment, financial and retirement planning services to individuals, foundations, and family offices, as well as 401(k) consulting and cash management services to corporations. With over $100B AUM, Hightower’s capital solutions, operational support services, size and scale empower its vibrant community of independent-minded wealth advisors to grow their businesses and help their clients achieve their vision of “well-th. rebalanced.” Based in Chicago with advisors across the U.S., the firm operates as a registered investment advisor (RIA).

Role & Responsibilities

We are seeking an experienced Chief Compliance Officer (“CCO”) who is a multi-tasker at heart, with strong communication skills and a problem-solving mindset that thrives in a fast-paced and evolving organization. Our ideal candidate consistently performs at a high level under variable workloads and has ability to form strong relationships across the firm. In this senior leadership role, the CCO is primarily responsible for overseeing compliance within the organization and ensuring compliance with laws, regulatory requirements, policies, and procedures. As the compliance leader and subject matter expert, the CCO is responsible for establishing standards and implementing procedures to ensure that the compliance programs throughout the organization are effective and efficient in identifying, preventing, detecting, and correcting noncompliance with applicable laws and regulations for multiple investment advisors, private funds, products, investment management, and a broker dealer. This position reports to the Chief Operating Officer and Head of Enterprise Protection and will have frequent interactions with executive leadership across the firm.


Required Competencies

Primary responsibilities include monitoring compliance risk behaviors and providing day-to-day Compliance advice relating to the supported function/business/product and guidance on function/business/product rules/laws and interpretation on internal policies and procedures

Serves as a compliance risk officer for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM)’s Financial Crime Testing team responsible
for leading reviews to assess compliance with laws, rules and regulations and corresponding Citi policies primarily through substantive testing.
The Compliance Testing VP assesses compliance risks and controls implemented by the first and second line of defense. Also responsible for performing risk assessments of Citi's compliance risks; performing independent testing activities (testing and on-going monitoring) to assess the design and effectiveness of key controls designed to address compliance risk; reporting and escalating control issues and any violations of laws or breaches of policy; and validating adequacy of remediation taken to address reported issues.

Chief Compliance Officer needed for Scottsdale Firm.
The CCO is responsible for establishing standards and implementing procedures to ensure that the compliance programs throughout the organization are effective and efficient in identifying, preventing, detecting and correcting noncompliance with applicable laws and regulations. Director of Consumer Compliance - (210000EH)
Description

The Director of Consumer Compliance is responsible for the continued successful operation of the bank’s Compliance Management System, providing oversight of its continued development, implementation and administration. The incumbent leads a team of regulatory compliance specialists primarily responsible for maintaining the company’s framework for compliance risk management, and provides strategic direction designed to support organizational growth, leadership and day-to-day management. This senior leadership position manages the support provided to all applicable areas of the bank in order to ensure compliance with federal and state consumer protection laws and regulations.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may also be assigned.

Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer - Healthcare Division

About the Company:

City+Ventures is a premier development and investment company focused on building companies and communities. With Omaha roots but regional and national assets, City+Ventures owns and operates a wide array of businesses, including automotive dealerships; carwashes; a private jet management and charter company; real estate management; and construction-related businesses, in addition to holding a real estate portfolio. In August 2020, City+Ventures’ proven track record of reinvention and financial success earned it the No. 71 spot on the Inc. 5000 Company list.

Summary:

Supporting City Ventures’ healthcare division – headquartered in Omaha, NE, with national operations - the Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer will build, execute, and maintain compliance excellence for our healthcare businesses. This newly created position will be a key position within our executive team. This role is responsible for the development of a comprehensive enterprise privacy, compliance, and risk management program. This position may be remote for individuals willing to travel up to 30%.

This role is responsible for ensuring company compliance with all federal and local laws and regulations, especially those in the healthcare industry. This person will work closely on the executive team, to create internal policies that are clear and concise and ensure proper, effective communication and training of policies and regulations across all departments and employees. The incumbent will be expected to build the department and processes, audit, keep up with changes to laws and regulations that may affect the company, and proactively develop action plans to ensure compliance at all times.

With operations spanning the US, the Chief Compliance Officer will need to be aware of an array of state and local laws. The incumbent of this position should have the ability to keep pace with a rapidly expanding company in an ever-changing legislative landscape.


Why work for City Ventures?

Summary
Our Firm's clientele is global by nature and complicated. As such, we require additional compliance professionals that have the appropriate experience and depth of knowledge of this global landscape.
The Compliance Officer will be part of the compliance team and will focus on all aspects of compliance, including Corporate, Consumer Protection and, most importantly, KYC/AML. The ideal candidate will have experience in compliance within the financial services industry. Candidates from Payments Firms, Money Services Businesses, and Traditional/Retail Banks will have the most suitable background.
Essential Functions.

About us
Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. In 2020, Lendistry provided Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans to small businesses in all 50 states and was selected by the State of California to administer the California Small Business COVID-19 Relief Grant Program, which distributed grants to the small businesses that lost significant revenues during the pandemic. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

Job Title: Senior Tableau Dev Position for Compliance Risk VP
Job Description:
Risk & Control technology within GFT is responsible for implementation of strategic solutions to manage compliance risk for Laws, Rules and Regulations (LRR), Policies, Assessments, risk assurance and reporting. There are many initiatives and journeys being started with objective to build target state solution through agile development process with multi-year deliverables and committed regulatory milestones. As part of these journeys, we are also responsible for working with various groups and teams from business systems, central data team and CDO to acquire data from business systems, perform data transformation and aggregation, and DQ validation of critical data elements (CDEs). We are also required to align ourselves with Citi enterprise-wide technology strategy, procedures and standards in the design and architecture of our compliance risk functions. We are expected to manage all inter-dependencies with other systems and integration with horizontal functions within risk & control to enable compliance risk users to effectively manage and monitor issues, breaches, and escalations across the firm.

Technology
Applications Development
Full time

Founded in 2008, Hightower is a wealth management firm that provides investment, financial and retirement planning services to individuals, foundations, and family offices, as well as 401(k) consulting and cash management services to corporations. With over $100B AUM, Hightower’s capital solutions, operational support services, size and scale empower its vibrant community of independent-minded wealth advisors to grow their businesses and help their clients achieve their vision of “well-th. rebalanced.” Based in Chicago with advisors across the U.S., the firm operates as a registered investment advisor (RIA).

Role & Responsibilities

We are seeking an experienced Chief Compliance Officer (“CCO”) who is a multi-tasker at heart, with strong communication skills and a problem-solving mindset that thrives in a fast-paced and evolving organization. Our ideal candidate consistently performs at a high level under variable workloads and has ability to form strong relationships across the firm. In this senior leadership role, the CCO is primarily responsible for overseeing compliance within the organization and ensuring compliance with laws, regulatory requirements, policies, and procedures. As the compliance leader and subject matter expert, the CCO is responsible for establishing standards and implementing procedures to ensure that the compliance programs throughout the organization are effective and efficient in identifying, preventing, detecting, and correcting noncompliance with applicable laws and regulations for multiple investment advisors, private funds, products, investment management, and a broker dealer. This position reports to the Chief Operating Officer and Head of Enterprise Protection and will have frequent interactions with executive leadership across the firm.


Required Competencies

Experience & Qualifications

Serves as a function/business/product compliance risk officer for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM) responsible for assisting with internal strategies, policies, procedures, processes, and programs to prevent violations of law, rule, or regulation and design and deliver a risk management framework that maintains risk levels within the firm's risk appetite and protect the franchise. In addition, engages with the ICRM Product and Function coverage teams, in order to partner to develop and apply CRM program solutions that meet the function/business/product and customer needs in a manner consistent with the Citi program framework. Primary responsibilities include monitoring compliance risk behaviors and providing day-to-day Compliance advice relating to the supported function/business/product and guidance on function/business/product rules/laws and interpretation on internal policies and procedures
.

Chief Compliance Officer needed for Scottsdale Firm.
The CCO is responsible for establishing standards and implementing procedures to ensure that the compliance programs throughout the organization are effective and efficient in identifying, preventing, detecting and correcting noncompliance with applicable laws and regulations. The CCO provides reasonable assurance to senior management and the Board that there are effective and efficient policies and procedures in place, well understood and respected by all employees, and that the company is complying with all regulatory requirements.
Responsibilities:
Develop and manage annual broker-dealer testing program to ensure full compliance with all relevant rules and regulations.

Director of Consumer Compliance - (210000EH)
Description

The Director of Consumer Compliance is responsible for the continued successful operation of the bank’s Compliance Management System, providing oversight of its continued development, implementation and administration. The incumbent leads a team of regulatory compliance specialists primarily responsible for maintaining the company’s framework for compliance risk management, and provides strategic direction designed to support organizational growth, leadership and day-to-day management. This senior leadership position manages the support provided to all applicable areas of the bank in order to ensure compliance with federal and state consumer protection laws and regulations.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may also be assigned.

Summary
Our Firm's clientele is global by nature and complicated. As such, we require additional compliance professionals that have the appropriate experience and depth of knowledge of this global landscape.
The Compliance Officer will be part of the compliance team and will focus on all aspects of compliance, including Corporate, Consumer Protection and, most importantly, KYC/AML. The ideal candidate will have experience in compliance within the financial services industry. Candidates from Payments Firms, Money Services Businesses, and Traditional/Retail Banks will have the most suitable background.
Essential Functions.

Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer - Healthcare Division

About the Company:

City+Ventures is a premier development and investment company focused on building companies and communities. With Omaha roots but regional and national assets, City+Ventures owns and operates a wide array of businesses, including automotive dealerships; carwashes; a private jet management and charter company; real estate management; and construction-related businesses, in addition to holding a real estate portfolio. In August 2020, City+Ventures’ proven track record of reinvention and financial success earned it the No. 71 spot on the Inc. 5000 Company list.

Summary:

Supporting City Ventures’ healthcare division – headquartered in Omaha, NE, with national operations - the Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer will build, execute, and maintain compliance excellence for our healthcare businesses. This newly created position will be a key position within our executive team. This role is responsible for the development of a comprehensive enterprise privacy, compliance, and risk management program. This position may be remote for individuals willing to travel up to 30%.

This role is responsible for ensuring company compliance with all federal and local laws and regulations, especially those in the healthcare industry. This person will work closely on the executive team, to create internal policies that are clear and concise and ensure proper, effective communication and training of policies and regulations across all departments and employees. The incumbent will be expected to build the department and processes, audit, keep up with changes to laws and regulations that may affect the company, and proactively develop action plans to ensure compliance at all times.

With operations spanning the US, the Chief Compliance Officer will need to be aware of an array of state and local laws. The incumbent of this position should have the ability to keep pace with a rapidly expanding company in an ever-changing legislative landscape.


Why work for City Ventures?

About us
Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. In 2020, Lendistry provided Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans to small businesses in all 50 states and was selected by the State of California to administer the California Small Business COVID-19 Relief Grant Program, which distributed grants to the small businesses that lost significant revenues during the pandemic. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.
As part of Freddie Mac’s return to the office pilot, all employees, contingent workers and visitors must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to be on-site unless they have an approved accommodation.
Position Overview:
The Senior Director of Compliance is responsible for establishing and maintaining the compliance risk management for the Freddie Mac Charter, Fair Lending and other consumer protection regulations, including oversight of third parties such as sellers and servicers. The role spans Freddie Mac’s major operating Divisions - Single Family, Multi Family, Investments & Capital Markets, as well as the other divisions as they pertain to the regulatory areas. Apply now and learn more about our benefits and why there’s #MoreAtFreddieMac!

Review Alliance is seeking experienced Bank Compliance Officers interested in working with community banks as a Virtual Compliance Officer. Successful candidates will review transactions for compliance with banking regulations and is responsible for completing reviews in the areas of compliance and making recommendations for corrections and/or improvements of internal control system, policies and regulatory procedure. This will require contact with bank personnel and the bank senior management group.
Review Alliance is a part of Bankers Alliance (B/A), which is the holding company for Compliance Alliance as well as Review Alliance. Our goal is to give community bankers reliable and trusted resources for consumer and regulatory requirements as well as best practices, while meeting strategic and operational objectives. Because B/A companies are solely focused on bank regulatory compliance at the community bank level, we can provide a focused, unfettered approach for our members. Developed with pragmatic innovation, our services add real value and industry expertise.

This global, full-service, independent brokerage and investment bank seeks dynamic candidates to join their Compliance team, located in Manhattan.

Assist with the reporting requirements of the Consolidated Audit Trail (“CAT”).
Investigating and resolving CAT events in relation to system and counterparty workflows.
Assist with trade surveillance and enhancement of exception reports.
Drafting of written supervisory procedures.
Responding to regulator inquiries and education of trade desks.

The Company:
Merit is a fast growing, pioneering financial services firm that invests heavily in the growth and development of team members. Merit seeks to establish, educate, and help individuals reach their financial goals as they transition into and experience retirement. With an unswerving commitment to excellence and reliability, Merit provides objective financial advice and believes in establishing long-lasting relationships. By offering an array of services, clients can receive tailored solutions that are aimed at promoting growth and help them work toward their financial goals.
Merit believes in addressing the retirement challenges in America by helping clients reach financial freedom and confidence to the working population and retirees alike. This focus on comprehensive financial wellness enables us to deliver the ultimate client experience.

Job Title: Ethics and Compliance Officer - Energy Global Business Unit
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 242638
Requisition Posting End Date: 11/24/2021
Position Summary:
The Energy Ethics and Compliance Officer is responsible for implementing the Bechtel companywide ethics and compliance program and related compliance activities within the Energy Global Business Unit (GBU) and implements and refines the GBU compliance and ethics strategy.
This responsibility includes:
Providing employees with prospective decision-making guidance and answering questions concerning the Bechtel standards of conduct;

We are actively searching for a motivated and experienced compliance officer to guarantee that our business processes and transactions follow all relevant legal and internal guidelines. Your duties will include reviewing employee work, developing company policies, and responding to policy violations.
The ideal candidate will be professional, highly analytical, and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. To prosper in this role, you should be fluent in risk management and our industry’s principles.
Responsibilities:
Implement and manage an effective legal compliance program.
Develop and review company policies.
Advise management on the company’s compliance with laws and regulations through detailed reports.

PURPOSE
To oversee, manage, and advise on compliance and governance matters for the global entity.
To coordinate the successful completion of external certification activities including PCI DSS Level 1 and SOC 2 Type II.
To maintain up-to-date expertise of the security standards, laws, and regulations applicable to all jurisdictions within which the global entity or its clients operate.
To utilize gained knowledge to advise global and regional leadership on compliance-impacting business decisions, processes, and implementations.
To facilitate interdepartmental and international communication and collaboration to implement organizational controls for compliance initiatives.

City+Ventures is a premier development and investment company focused on building companies and communities. With Omaha roots but regional and national assets, City+Ventures owns and operates a wide array of businesses, including automotive dealerships; carwashes; a private jet management and charter company; real estate management; and construction-related businesses, in addition to holding a real estate portfolio. Summary:

Supporting City Ventures’ healthcare division – headquartered in Omaha, NE, with national operations - the Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer will build, execute, and maintain compliance excellence for our healthcare businesses. This newly created position will be a key position within our executive team. This role is responsible for the development of a comprehensive enterprise privacy, compliance, and risk management program. This position may be remote for individuals willing to travel up to 30%.

This role is responsible for ensuring company compliance with all federal and local laws and regulations, especially those in the healthcare industry. This person will work closely on the executive team, to create internal policies that are clear and concise and ensure proper, effective communication and training of policies and regulations across all departments and employees. The incumbent will be expected to build the department and processes, audit, keep up with changes to laws and regulations that may affect the company, and proactively develop action plans to ensure compliance at all times.

With operations spanning the US, the Chief Compliance Officer will need to be aware of an array of state and local laws. The incumbent of this position should have the ability to keep pace with a rapidly expanding company in an ever-changing legislative landscape.


Why work for City Ventures?

Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

NSA Overview NSA's mission is to help protect national security by providing policy makers and military commanders with the intelligence information they need to do their jobs. In order to ensure that operations occur within the established laws, authorities, policies and directives, NSA has built a robust compliance office and program to meet this goal. Do you want to help protect national security by ensuring operations occur in a compliant manner? If so, a Compliance Officer job may be right for you! Compliance Officers develop and implement comprehensive mission compliance solutions to keep NSA's activities consistent with the laws, policies, and procedures designed to protect privacy during mission operations. They support the development, implementation, and monitoring of a mission compliance program that includes internal control activities, risk assessments, standards and procedures, awareness and training, and verification and assessment to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Description of the Position The responsibilities of a Compliance Officer include: - Ensuring compliance with laws, legal codes, practices, documents, precedents, court procedures, executive orders, government organization/functions - Completing compliance auditing, monitoring, and verification activities (interviewing, planning, developing) - Using investigative techniques, laws, directives and applying investigative standards, policies and procedures necessary to make competent investigative determinations - Serving as a liaison between groups internal or external to the Agency - Identifying a need for and knowing where or how to gather information - Managing compliance incidents or processes, perform root cause analysis and develop mitigation strategies
