NSA Overview NSA's mission is to help protect national security by providing policy makers and military commanders with the intelligence information they need to do their jobs. In order to ensure that operations occur within the established laws, authorities, policies and directives, NSA has built a robust compliance office and program to meet this goal. Do you want to help protect national security by ensuring operations occur in a compliant manner? If so, a Compliance Officer job may be right for you! Compliance Officers develop and implement comprehensive mission compliance solutions to keep NSA's activities consistent with the laws, policies, and procedures designed to protect privacy during mission operations. They support the development, implementation, and monitoring of a mission compliance program that includes internal control activities, risk assessments, standards and procedures, awareness and training, and verification and assessment to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Description of the Position The responsibilities of a Compliance Officer include: - Ensuring compliance with laws, legal codes, practices, documents, precedents, court procedures, executive orders, government organization/functions - Completing compliance auditing, monitoring, and verification activities (interviewing, planning, developing) - Using investigative techniques, laws, directives and applying investigative standards, policies and procedures necessary to make competent investigative determinations - Serving as a liaison between groups internal or external to the Agency - Identifying a need for and knowing where or how to gather information - Managing compliance incidents or processes, perform root cause analysis and develop mitigation strategies

Description

The Director of Consumer Compliance is responsible for the continued successful operation of the bank’s Compliance Management System, providing oversight of its continued development, implementation and administration. The incumbent leads a team of regulatory compliance specialists primarily responsible for maintaining the company’s framework for compliance risk management, and provides strategic direction designed to support organizational growth, leadership and day-to-day management. This senior leadership position manages the support provided to all applicable areas of the bank in order to ensure compliance with federal and state consumer protection laws and regulations.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may also be assigned.

About us
Lendistry (lendistry.com) is a minority-led and technology-enabled small business and commercial real estate lender with Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Entity (CDE) certification. Lendistry ranks second nationwide in SBA Community Advantage lending, providing responsible financing to small business owners and their underserved communities. Lendistry is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco, headquartered in a Los Angeles Opportunity Zone. In 2020, Lendistry provided Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans to small businesses in all 50 states and was selected by the State of California to administer the California Small Business COVID-19 Relief Grant Program, which distributed grants to the small businesses that lost significant revenues during the pandemic. Lendistry and its nonprofit partner organization, The Center by Lendistry, are dedicated to providing economic opportunities and progressive growth for underserved urban and rural small business borrowers and their communities.

Job Title: Compliance Officer - Financial Crime Anti- Money Laundering & Tax
Job Description:
#LI-TL1 #HSBCUSA
As a Compliance Officer on our Financial Crime – Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Tax Transparency Program and Policy Team, and reporting directly to the US Head of AML and Tax Transparency, you will provide risk stewardship relating to the specific financial crime threats the firm faces now and in the future, contributing to processes and frameworks that protect our business, our customers, and the many communities in which we operate, from the harms associated with financial crime. The AML and Tax Transparency Program and Policy team is responsible for oversight and risk stewardship of the AML and Tax Transparency programs at HSBC in the US. We coordinate policy and program changes across all of our businesses, liaise with our counterparts at the Global level and provide subject matter expertise to all lines of business and functions on AML and Tax Transparency issues. The team is responsible for Policy changes, serves as a thought leader in public debate regarding proposed changes in the regulatory compliance landscape, leads bank initiatives relating to new and changing AML and Tax Transparency regulatory requirements, advises businesses regarding regulatory changes, and partners with other functions within Financial Crime (FC), including Investigations, Risk and Analysis, and the Lines of Business FC teams, to support our businesses and coordinate oversight of risks and controls across the organization.

The global privacy regulatory landscape is not static and the product and technical landscape at Facebook changes multiple times daily to continue to meet and exceed the needs of our 3 Billion plus users on our platform. The Chief Compliance and Privacy Officer oversees the Corporate Compliance, Information Privacy and Ethics Programs at Dayton Children’s Hospital, functioning as an independent and objective body that reviews and evaluates compliance issues/concerns within the organization. This position is responsible for establishing and implementing a Compliance, Privacy and Ethics Program(s); including fraud, waste and abuse (FWA) prevention and detection program, in order to maintain the highest level of ethics and to comply with all relevant federal and state statutes, regulations and other guidance.

The Chief Compliance and Privacy Officer acts as staff to the CEO and Board of Trustees by monitoring and reporting results of the compliance/ethics efforts of the company and in providing guidance for the Board and executive/senior management team on matters relating to compliance. The Chief Compliance Officer is authorized to implement all necessary actions to ensure achievement of the objectives of an effective compliance program.

Schwab Charitable is an independent public charity created to increase charitable giving in the United States by offering the flexible giving solution of a donor-advised fund (DAF) account. A donor-advised fund account is a simple, flexible, tax-smart investment account designed specifically for charitable purposes that offers clients and advisors a simple and streamlined way to contribute, invest and grant effectively. We are a leading national donor-advised fund provider—having granted out to over 190,000 charities nationwide since inception on behalf of our donors.

At Schwab Charitable, we believe people have an inherent desire to give and that investing and giving when done together can empower us to make a real difference in the world. We make it easy to integrate charitable giving into clients’ financial planning and wealth management conversations. We believe that if our clients apply the same thoughtful strategy to their giving and philanthropy that they apply to their finances and investments, they will be happier and more fulfilled donors. With our uniquely integrated approach, our simple and tax-smart giving solution, our access to online resources and our team of charitable specialists, we offer the tools, guidance and relationships to help donors give more to the charities that matter most to them.

We strive to have the programs in place that meet those needs.

The role contributes to ensuring Compliance Testing is a strong, transparent and well-governed organization by supporting key governance processes and by finding and creating efficiencies in the governance processes, templates and reporting. Additionally, this role is responsible for identifying process improvement opportunities, where appropriate, and manages approved enhancements.

Developing, implementing, and executing compliance testing, continuous testing, and reporting programs within an assigned region in accordance with the Compliance Testing (CT) Plan.
Compliance and Control
Assurance

We are actively searching for a motivated and experienced compliance officer to guarantee that our business processes and transactions follow all relevant legal and internal guidelines. Your duties will include reviewing employee work, developing company policies, and responding to policy violations.
The ideal candidate will be professional, highly analytical, and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. To prosper in this role, you should be fluent in risk management and our industry’s principles.
Responsibilities:
Implement and manage an effective legal compliance program.
Develop and review company policies.
Advise management on the company’s compliance with laws and regulations through detailed reports.

Serves as a compliance risk officer for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM)’s Financial Crime Testing team responsible
for leading reviews to assess compliance with laws, rules and regulations and corresponding Citi policies primarily through substantive testing.
The Compliance Testing VP assesses compliance risks and controls implemented by the first and second line of defense. Also responsible for performing risk assessments of Citi's compliance risks; performing independent testing activities (testing and on-going monitoring) to assess the design and effectiveness of key controls designed to address compliance risk; reporting and escalating control issues and any violations of laws or breaches of policy; and validating adequacy of remediation taken to address reported issues.

The Director, Compliance will serve as the Chief Compliance Officer of First National Advisers, and is responsible for ensuring the RIA meets all compliance obligations under Investment Advisers Act of 1940 (“Advisers Act”) and rules promulgated thereunder by the US Securities and Exchange Commissions (“SEC”). The RIA will have a traditional client servicing model, providing investment advice, investment management, planning and relationship management services. The RIA is a Bank affiliate and the successful candidate will understand how the RIA interacts with Bank Trust Department customers and other RIAs affiliated with the Bank. The individual will manage all aspects of SEC examinations and may interact with other regulators as needed.

SFOX is the all-in-one digital assets platform for prime brokerage, trade execution, and custody. Founded in 2014, we are the world’s only end-to-end cryptocurrency prime broker. As the leading digital asset brokerage, we are at the forefront of safety and security while providing a fast and effective trading platform to customers. With a single account we connect customers to 50+ different liquidity providers and provide them the algorithmic trading tools to be one step ahead of the market. We’re funded by leading investors including Social Capital, Khosla Ventures, Haystack, and Y Combinator.
We’re on a mission to open the world’s financial markets to everyone and we’re looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing team.
About the position:
We continue to build a world-class legal and compliance team to support SFOX and its affiliates as our growth accelerates.

What is the opportunity?
As the Director, Consumer Compliance, you lead Wealth Management NY Credit Branch Consumer compliance strategy (to include consumer, privacy, and safety & soundness) in line with Global Compliance standards.You will nsure quality and consistency of consumer compliance standards and performance for the WM NY Credit Branch. Additionally, you will support and enable business objectives by ensuring the WM NY Credit Branch is equipped to meet all relevant regulatory requirements, ensuring compliance management is firmly embedded in business unit culture. You will also manage Compliance risks to an acceptable level and work with industry bodies and regulators to develop compliance program and share best practices.

What will you do?

The global privacy regulatory landscape is not static and the product and technical landscape at Facebook changes multiple times daily to continue to meet and exceed the needs of our 3 Billion plus users on our platform. The Director of Compliance Operations works at the center of privacy regulation, legal, business, product and engineering to put our user’s privacy at the center of everything we do.The Privacy Compliance team is part of Facebook’s Global Central Privacy program and establishes, diagnoses, improves and manages compliance for better user outcomes and operational effectiveness while providing visibility into compliance at every step along the way. The Privacy Compliance Operations team is responsible for creating, maintaining and improving our company-wide privacy compliance operations to improve the reliability and maturity of our privacy practices.We are looking for a talented seasoned leader who brings operational scale and deep privacy and compliance expertise to lead and develop an industry leading privacy program. Someone who shares our passion for tackling privacy complexities head-on, to help design and build continuous operational compliance practices at massive scale while representing our users and their privacy at the forefront of everything that we do.In this role, you will create and improve company-wide operational processes to establish, measure and improve privacy practices, compliance measures, execute testing and report on the state of compliance. This role will be a trusted partner to product, business, legal and engineering teams across the company to develop deep insights and drive improvements into the mechanics of how teams incorporate compliance and privacy-by-design into operations and product life cycles.

Front Financial is looking for an experienced Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) to join our team. This position develops, implements, and manages a comprehensive annual compliance work plan to ensure that financial and operational procedures and personal conduct comply with all applicable national and international laws, policies, and contractual agreements in a manner that supports the company and its operational areas.
The CCO reports directly to the Chief Executive Officer. She/He must also inform the Board about important issues and material violations.
CCO Duties and Responsibilities:
Design, implement and enforce company-wide compliance programs to ensure compliance with the company Code of Conduct and all applicable U.S. laws, rules, and regulations

WHY ASANTE

Asante is more than a great hospital system in an amazing location. We are a community of passionate providers and service-focused caregivers who collaborate to deliver amazing patient outcomes; a place where titles don't matter as much as your creativity, drive, and passion. Our culture, values and people create an environment of sustained medical excellence. All three Asante hospitals have earned five stars from CMS for overall quality - the top rating given. In fact, Asante accounts for three of the five Oregon hospitals to achieve this rare honor.

Your Opportunity

Schwab Charitable is an independent public charity created to increase charitable giving in the United States by offering the flexible giving solution of a donor-advised fund (DAF) account. A donor-advised fund account is a simple, flexible, tax-smart investment account designed specifically for charitable purposes that offers clients and advisors a simple and streamlined way to contribute, invest and grant effectively. We are a leading national donor-advised fund provider—having granted out to over 190,000 charities nationwide since inception on behalf of our donors.

At Schwab Charitable, we believe people have an inherent desire to give and that investing and giving when done together can empower us to make a real difference in the world. We make it easy to integrate charitable giving into clients’ financial planning and wealth management conversations. We believe that if our clients apply the same thoughtful strategy to their giving and philanthropy that they apply to their finances and investments, they will be happier and more fulfilled donors. With our uniquely integrated approach, our simple and tax-smart giving solution, our access to online resources and our team of charitable specialists, we offer the tools, guidance and relationships to help donors give more to the charities that matter most to them.

You belong here- come discover your story at Adaptive.

This Chief Compliance Officer ("CCO") is a highly strategic partner that will manage and oversee the Adaptive's compliance program. This role will shape, drive and ensure full implementation of an effective compliance program, influence the organization's strategy, and support collaboration with the business. The CCO will have primary responsibility over the development of Compliance policies, practices, education and awareness.

Director of Consumer Compliance - (210000EH)
Description

The Director of Consumer Compliance is responsible for the continued successful operation of the bank’s Compliance Management System, providing oversight of its continued development, implementation and administration. The incumbent leads a team of regulatory compliance specialists primarily responsible for maintaining the company’s framework for compliance risk management, and provides strategic direction designed to support organizational growth, leadership and day-to-day management. This senior leadership position manages the support provided to all applicable areas of the bank in order to ensure compliance with federal and state consumer protection laws and regulations.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may also be assigned.

This global, full-service, independent brokerage and investment bank seeks dynamic candidates to join their Compliance team, located in Manhattan.
Duties will include:
Assist with the reporting requirements of the Consolidated Audit Trail (“CAT”).
Investigating and resolving CAT events in relation to system and counterparty workflows.
Assist with trade surveillance and enhancement of exception reports.
Drafting of written supervisory procedures.
Responding to regulator inquiries and education of trade desks.

Job Description:
Address:

Supports the business/group leader in the effective implementation, maintenance and administration of first line of defense (1st LOD) compliance program, including overseeing business operations within the jurisdiction to ensure adherence and efficiency. The Company:
Merit is a fast growing, pioneering financial services firm that invests heavily in the growth and development of team members. Merit seeks to establish, educate, and help individuals reach their financial goals as they transition into and experience retirement. With an unswerving commitment to excellence and reliability, Merit provides objective financial advice and believes in establishing long-lasting relationships. By offering an array of services, clients can receive tailored solutions that are aimed at promoting growth and help them work toward their financial goals.
Merit believes in addressing the retirement challenges in America by helping clients reach financial freedom and confidence to the working population and retirees alike. This focus on comprehensive financial wellness enables us to deliver the ultimate client experience.

Review Alliance is seeking experienced Bank Compliance Officers interested in working with community banks as a Virtual Compliance Officer. Successful candidates will review transactions for compliance with banking regulations and is responsible for completing reviews in the areas of compliance and making recommendations for corrections and/or improvements of internal control system, policies and regulatory procedure. This will require contact with bank personnel and the bank senior management group.
Review Alliance is a part of Bankers Alliance (B/A), which is the holding company for Compliance Alliance as well as Review Alliance. Our goal is to give community bankers reliable and trusted resources for consumer and regulatory requirements as well as best practices, while meeting strategic and operational objectives. Because B/A companies are solely focused on bank regulatory compliance at the community bank level, we can provide a focused, unfettered approach for our members. Developed with pragmatic innovation, our services add real value and industry expertise.

At FNBO, our employees are the heart of our story—and we’re committed to their success! Please see below the details of this career opportunity and how it fits into our organization’s success.
This role can work remotely, but must be willing to travel to Omaha for exams.



The Director, Compliance will serve as the Chief Compliance Officer of First National Advisers, and is responsible for ensuring the RIA meets all compliance obligations under Investment Advisers Act of 1940 (“Advisers Act”) and rules promulgated thereunder by the US Securities and Exchange Commissions (“SEC”). The RIA will have a traditional client servicing model, providing investment advice, investment management, planning and relationship management services. The RIA is a Bank affiliate and the successful candidate will understand how the RIA interacts with Bank Trust Department customers and other RIAs affiliated with the Bank. This individual will work closely with Corporate Compliance peers, business line leaders and first line risk partners to collaborate on processes and controls that ensure compliance and manage risk. The individual will manage all aspects of SEC examinations and may interact with other regulators as needed.

Compensation range (base pay): $93,077.00-$148,710.00
IMPORTANT - This range is for the primary posting location of: Work at Home - Nebraska
Job number: R-20212098

Job Description Summary
The GE Digital Chief Compliance Officer will have responsibility for managing GE Digital’s compliance and ethics programs and oversight of the group’s enterprise risk management (ERM) program. This role requires strategic vision and superb execution skills to deliver, simple effective and audit-ready compliance processes for both culture and core risk areas and to influence executives and employees to manage and mitigate broad enterprise risks.

Essential Responsibilities
Include, but are not limited to:

Wealth Management Compliance Policies Officer
Job Number:
3182669

PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-Maryland-Baltimore
OTHER LOCATIONS: Americas-United States of America-Illinois-Chicago

DESCRIPTION

SFOX is the all-in-one digital assets platform for prime brokerage, trade execution, and custody. Founded in 2014, we are the world’s only end-to-end cryptocurrency prime broker. As the leading digital asset brokerage, we are at the forefront of safety and security while providing a fast and effective trading platform to customers. With a single account we connect customers to 50+ different liquidity providers and provide them the algorithmic trading tools to be one step ahead of the market. We’re funded by leading investors including Social Capital, Khosla Ventures, Haystack, and Y Combinator.
We’re on a mission to open the world’s financial markets to everyone and we’re looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing team.
About the position:
We continue to build a world-class legal and compliance team to support SFOX and its affiliates as our growth accelerates.

What is the opportunity?
As the Director, Consumer Compliance, you lead Wealth Management NY Credit Branch Consumer compliance strategy (to include consumer, privacy, and safety & soundness) in line with Global Compliance standards.You will nsure quality and consistency of consumer compliance standards and performance for the WM NY Credit Branch. Additionally, you will support and enable business objectives by ensuring the WM NY Credit Branch is equipped to meet all relevant regulatory requirements, ensuring compliance management is firmly embedded in business unit culture. You will also manage Compliance risks to an acceptable level and work with industry bodies and regulators to develop compliance program and share best practices.

What will you do?

The global privacy regulatory landscape is not static and the product and technical landscape at Facebook changes multiple times daily to continue to meet and exceed the needs of our 3 Billion plus users on our platform. The Director of Compliance Operations works at the center of privacy regulation, legal, business, product and engineering to put our user’s privacy at the center of everything we do.The Privacy Compliance team is part of Facebook’s Global Central Privacy program and establishes, diagnoses, improves and manages compliance for better user outcomes and operational effectiveness while providing visibility into compliance at every step along the way. The Privacy Compliance Operations team is responsible for creating, maintaining and improving our company-wide privacy compliance operations to improve the reliability and maturity of our privacy practices.We are looking for a talented seasoned leader who brings operational scale and deep privacy and compliance expertise to lead and develop an industry leading privacy program. Someone who shares our passion for tackling privacy complexities head-on, to help design and build continuous operational compliance practices at massive scale while representing our users and their privacy at the forefront of everything that we do.In this role, you will create and improve company-wide operational processes to establish, measure and improve privacy practices, compliance measures, execute testing and report on the state of compliance. This role will be a trusted partner to product, business, legal and engineering teams across the company to develop deep insights and drive improvements into the mechanics of how teams incorporate compliance and privacy-by-design into operations and product life cycles.











Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Front Financial is looking for an experienced Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) to join our team. This position develops, implements, and manages a comprehensive annual compliance work plan to ensure that financial and operational procedures and personal conduct comply with all applicable national and international laws, policies, and contractual agreements in a manner that supports the company and its operational areas.
The CCO reports directly to the Chief Executive Officer. She/He must also inform the Board about important issues and material violations.
CCO Duties and Responsibilities:
Design, implement and enforce company-wide compliance programs to ensure compliance with the company Code of Conduct and all applicable U.S. laws, rules, and regulations

FTE: 1.0, or 40 hours/week
Work Schedule and Location: Primarily Monday - Friday from 8 am to 5 pm; this position is located in and works out of Southern Oregon
Salary: $169,728 - $226,304/yr, based on qualifications and years of relevant experience
WHY ASANTE

Asante is more than a great hospital system in an amazing location. We are a community of passionate providers and service-focused caregivers who collaborate to deliver amazing patient outcomes; a place where titles don't matter as much as your creativity, drive, and passion. Our culture, values and people create an environment of sustained medical excellence. All three Asante hospitals have earned five stars from CMS for overall quality - the top rating given. In fact, Asante accounts for three of the five Oregon hospitals to achieve this rare honor.

Your Opportunity

Schwab Charitable is an independent public charity created to increase charitable giving in the United States by offering the flexible giving solution of a donor-advised fund (DAF) account. A donor-advised fund account is a simple, flexible, tax-smart investment account designed specifically for charitable purposes that offers clients and advisors a simple and streamlined way to contribute, invest and grant effectively. We are a leading national donor-advised fund provider—having granted out to over 190,000 charities nationwide since inception on behalf of our donors.

At Schwab Charitable, we believe people have an inherent desire to give and that investing and giving when done together can empower us to make a real difference in the world. We make it easy to integrate charitable giving into clients’ financial planning and wealth management conversations. We believe that if our clients apply the same thoughtful strategy to their giving and philanthropy that they apply to their finances and investments, they will be happier and more fulfilled donors. With our uniquely integrated approach, our simple and tax-smart giving solution, our access to online resources and our team of charitable specialists, we offer the tools, guidance and relationships to help donors give more to the charities that matter most to them.

We are powering the age of immune medicine- you can too. At Adaptive, our goal is to meaningfully improve people's lives by learning from the wisdom of the adaptive immune system.
As an Adapter, you will be surrounded by driven colleagues who think boldly to pursue ground-breaking innovation. You will experience meaningful challenge in your work and be fueled by motivating energy knowing you make a difference in people's lives.
You belong here- come discover your story at Adaptive.

Position Overview
This Chief Compliance Officer ("CCO") is a highly strategic partner that will manage and oversee the Adaptive's compliance program. This role will shape, drive and ensure full implementation of an effective compliance program, influence the organization's strategy, and support collaboration with the business. The CCO will have primary responsibility over the development of Compliance policies, practices, education and awareness.

Director of Consumer Compliance - (210000EH)
Description

The Director of Consumer Compliance is responsible for the continued successful operation of the bank’s Compliance Management System, providing oversight of its continued development, implementation and administration. The incumbent leads a team of regulatory compliance specialists primarily responsible for maintaining the company’s framework for compliance risk management, and provides strategic direction designed to support organizational growth, leadership and day-to-day management. This senior leadership position manages the support provided to all applicable areas of the bank in order to ensure compliance with federal and state consumer protection laws and regulations.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may also be assigned.

This global, full-service, independent brokerage and investment bank seeks dynamic candidates to join their Compliance team, located in Manhattan.
Duties will include:
Assist with the reporting requirements of the Consolidated Audit Trail (“CAT”).
Investigating and resolving CAT events in relation to system and counterparty workflows.
Assist with trade surveillance and enhancement of exception reports.
Drafting of written supervisory procedures.
Responding to regulator inquiries and education of trade desks.

Job Title: Senior Compliance Officer, First Line Monitoring & Testing
Job Description:
Address:
111 W Monroe - 115 S LaSalle
Job Family Group:
Business Management
Supports the business/group leader in the effective implementation, maintenance and administration of first line of defense (1st LOD) compliance program, including overseeing business operations within the jurisdiction to ensure adherence and efficiency. Contributes to a strong risk management culture through collaboration with other first line employees, and second & third line functions to ensure Compliance risks are identified, mitigated, monitored, tested and reported on an ongoing basis.

The Company:
Merit is a fast growing, pioneering financial services firm that invests heavily in the growth and development of team members. Merit seeks to establish, educate, and help individuals reach their financial goals as they transition into and experience retirement. With an unswerving commitment to excellence and reliability, Merit provides objective financial advice and believes in establishing long-lasting relationships. By offering an array of services, clients can receive tailored solutions that are aimed at promoting growth and help them work toward their financial goals.
Merit believes in addressing the retirement challenges in America by helping clients reach financial freedom and confidence to the working population and retirees alike. This focus on comprehensive financial wellness enables us to deliver the ultimate client experience.

Review Alliance is seeking experienced Bank Compliance Officers interested in working with community banks as a Virtual Compliance Officer. Successful candidates will review transactions for compliance with banking regulations and is responsible for completing reviews in the areas of compliance and making recommendations for corrections and/or improvements of internal control system, policies and regulatory procedure. This will require contact with bank personnel and the bank senior management group.
Review Alliance is a part of Bankers Alliance (B/A), which is the holding company for Compliance Alliance as well as Review Alliance. Our goal is to give community bankers reliable and trusted resources for consumer and regulatory requirements as well as best practices, while meeting strategic and operational objectives. Because B/A companies are solely focused on bank regulatory compliance at the community bank level, we can provide a focused, unfettered approach for our members. Developed with pragmatic innovation, our services add real value and industry expertise.

Job Title: Senior Compliance Officer - Consumer Banking Compliance Risk Assessments
Job Description:
Serves as a senior Global Consumer Bank (GCB) Product Compliance risk officer for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM) responsible for establishing internal strategies, policies, procedures, processes, and programs to prevent violations of law, rule, or regulation and design and deliver a risk management framework that maintains risk levels within the firm's risk appetite and protect the franchise. In addition, engages with the ICRM product and function coverage teams, to partner, develop and apply Compliance Risk Management program solutions that meet the Global Consumer Bank business and customer needs in a manner consistent with the Citi program framework. Primary responsibilities include monitoring compliance risk behaviors, providing day-to-day Compliance advice relating to operations, financial requirements, and guidance on the Global Consumer Bank business and the associated regulatory rules/laws and interpretation on internal policies and procedures.
Responsibilities:
Compliance and Control
Compliance Risk Management

The Compliance Business Control Sr Analyst will sit within the Customer Experience and Process Integration Vertical within the Global Fraud Prevention team and support Transformation related Compliance, Risk and Control activities. This role will be responsible for the orchestration and coordination of key Transformation initiatives, including serving as a liaison between subject matter experts and Transformation leaders.
Responsibilities:
Track and monitor activities and requirements associated with issue management, thematic audit or review assessment trends (internal audits, quality assurance reviews, operational risk reviews), operational risk management (including MCA), compliance related concerns (including regulatory impact mapping or RIM).
Convert raw data into useful metrics and reportable information for Transformation efforts and senior leadership reviews.

Compliance and Control
Business Control

Develop the and manage the organization's risk management and compliance strategy ensuring adherence to all rules/regulations impacting mortgage origination and servicing

Job Title: Compliance Testing Sr Officer I - Consumer Compliance Testing
Job Description:
The Governance and Oversight Lead is a role within the Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM) organization, focused on tracking annual plan progress, and tracking and coordination of governance and oversight requests. The role contributes to ensuring Compliance Testing is a strong, transparent and well-governed organization by supporting key governance processes and by finding and creating efficiencies in the governance processes, templates and reporting. Additionally, this role is responsible for identifying process improvement opportunities, where appropriate, and manages approved enhancements.
Key Activities include:
Developing, implementing, and executing compliance testing, continuous testing, and reporting programs within an assigned region in accordance with the Compliance Testing (CT) Plan.
Compliance and Control
Assurance

We are actively searching for a motivated and experienced compliance officer to guarantee that our business processes and transactions follow all relevant legal and internal guidelines. Your duties will include reviewing employee work, developing company policies, and responding to policy violations.
The ideal candidate will be professional, highly analytical, and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. To prosper in this role, you should be fluent in risk management and our industry’s principles.
Responsibilities:
Implement and manage an effective legal compliance program.
Develop and review company policies.
Advise management on the company’s compliance with laws and regulations through detailed reports.

Job Title: Compliance Testing Officer - Financial Crimes - VP
Job Description:
Serves as a compliance risk officer for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM)’s Financial Crime Testing team responsible
for leading reviews to assess compliance with laws, rules and regulations and corresponding Citi policies primarily through substantive testing.
The Compliance Testing VP assesses compliance risks and controls implemented by the first and second line of defense. Also responsible for performing risk assessments of Citi's compliance risks; performing independent testing activities (testing and on-going monitoring) to assess the design and effectiveness of key controls designed to address compliance risk; reporting and escalating control issues and any violations of laws or breaches of policy; and validating adequacy of remediation taken to address reported issues.
Key Activities include:
Compliance and Control
Assurance

An exquisite opportunity awaits for an experienced Director of Performance Improvement. An award-winning hospital is searching to add a Director to join their highly professional health care team.

Compassionately serving their community for over 100 years. Understanding that each patient requires their own specific treatment plan, the medical staff at this hospital are equipped with advanced medical technology that allows them to provide tailored care for their patients. Administering care that treats both a patient’s physical needs and mental health needs are a top priority for this dedicated clinical staff. The Director will be joining a hard-working patient care services department who have worked tirelessly to maintain their honorable reputation not just in the state of GA, but across the country.

Situated in the beautiful Atlanta area, this hospital is surrounded by shopping, fine dining, and scenic parks. The Director of Performance Improvement will just have a quick commute to Atlanta. The best of both worlds is at the fingertips of the Director.

This innovative hospital is moving quickly to add a Director of Performance Improvement and are fully prepared offer a competitive compensation and full benefits package. Don't let this opportunity pass you by and apply today!

Director of Security and Compliance is needed for a large Casino in Michigan, tasked to implement, direct, guide and oversee the administration of Security, Safety, Casino internal controls, audits, and, Federal and State compliance programs and gaming regulations.

Responsible for the complete management of the department to ensure excellent guest service, while maximizing profits and property presentation according to policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
Coordinate with local law enforcement regarding illegal activities occurring on the property.
Direct emergency management during emergencies.

Director of Consumer Compliance - (210000EH)
Description

The Director of Consumer Compliance is responsible for the continued successful operation of the bank’s Compliance Management System, providing oversight of its continued development, implementation and administration. The incumbent leads a team of regulatory compliance specialists primarily responsible for maintaining the company’s framework for compliance risk management, and provides strategic direction designed to support organizational growth, leadership and day-to-day management. This senior leadership position manages the support provided to all applicable areas of the bank in order to ensure compliance with federal and state consumer protection laws and regulations.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may also be assigned.

This global, full-service, independent brokerage and investment bank seeks dynamic candidates to join their Compliance team, located in Manhattan.
Duties will include:
Assist with the reporting requirements of the Consolidated Audit Trail (“CAT”).
Investigating and resolving CAT events in relation to system and counterparty workflows.
Assist with trade surveillance and enhancement of exception reports.
Drafting of written supervisory procedures.
Responding to regulator inquiries and education of trade desks.

Review Alliance is seeking experienced Bank Compliance Officers interested in working with community banks as a Virtual Compliance Officer. Successful candidates will review transactions for compliance with banking regulations and is responsible for completing reviews in the areas of compliance and making recommendations for corrections and/or improvements of internal control system, policies and regulatory procedure. This will require contact with bank personnel and the bank senior management group.
Review Alliance is a part of Bankers Alliance (B/A), which is the holding company for Compliance Alliance as well as Review Alliance. Our goal is to give community bankers reliable and trusted resources for consumer and regulatory requirements as well as best practices, while meeting strategic and operational objectives. Because B/A companies are solely focused on bank regulatory compliance at the community bank level, we can provide a focused, unfettered approach for our members. Developed with pragmatic innovation, our services add real value and industry expertise.

Job Title: Senior Compliance Officer - Consumer Banking Compliance Risk Assessments

Serves as a senior Global Consumer Bank (GCB) Product Compliance risk officer for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM) responsible for establishing internal strategies, policies, procedures, processes, and programs to prevent violations of law, rule, or regulation and design and deliver a risk management framework that maintains risk levels within the firm's risk appetite and protect the franchise. In addition, engages with the ICRM product and function coverage teams, to partner, develop and apply Compliance Risk Management program solutions that meet the Global Consumer Bank business and customer needs in a manner consistent with the Citi program framework. The Director, Compliance will serve as the Chief Compliance Officer of First National Advisers, and is responsible for ensuring the RIA meets all compliance obligations under Investment Advisers Act of 1940 (“Advisers Act”) and rules promulgated thereunder by the US Securities and Exchange Commissions (“SEC”). The RIA will have a traditional client servicing model, providing investment advice, investment management, planning and relationship management services. The RIA is a Bank affiliate and the successful candidate will understand how the RIA interacts with Bank Trust Department customers and other RIAs affiliated with the Bank. DESCRIPTION

SFOX is the all-in-one digital assets platform for prime brokerage, trade execution, and custody. Founded in 2014, we are the world’s only end-to-end cryptocurrency prime broker. As the leading digital asset brokerage, we are at the forefront of safety and security while providing a fast and effective trading platform to customers. With a single account we connect customers to 50+ different liquidity providers and provide them the algorithmic trading tools to be one step ahead of the market. We’re funded by leading investors including Social Capital, Khosla Ventures, Haystack, and Y Combinator.
We’re on a mission to open the world’s financial markets to everyone and we’re looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing team.
About the position:
We continue to build a world-class legal and compliance team to support SFOX and its affiliates as our growth accelerates.

What is the opportunity?
As the Director, Consumer Compliance, you lead Wealth Management NY Credit Branch Consumer compliance strategy (to include consumer, privacy, and safety & soundness) in line with Global Compliance standards.You will nsure quality and consistency of consumer compliance standards and performance for the WM NY Credit Branch. Additionally, you will support and enable business objectives by ensuring the WM NY Credit Branch is equipped to meet all relevant regulatory requirements, ensuring compliance management is firmly embedded in business unit culture. You will also manage Compliance risks to an acceptable level and work with industry bodies and regulators to develop compliance program and share best practices.

What will you do?

The global privacy regulatory landscape is not static and the product and technical landscape at Facebook changes multiple times daily to continue to meet and exceed the needs of our 3 Billion plus users on our platform. The Director of Compliance Operations works at the center of privacy regulation, legal, business, product and engineering to put our user’s privacy at the center of everything we do.The Privacy Compliance team is part of Facebook’s Global Central Privacy program and establishes, diagnoses, improves and manages compliance for better user outcomes and operational effectiveness while providing visibility into compliance at every step along the way. The Privacy Compliance Operations team is responsible for creating, maintaining and improving our company-wide privacy compliance operations to improve the reliability and maturity of our privacy practices.We are looking for a talented seasoned leader who brings operational scale and deep privacy and compliance expertise to lead and develop an industry leading privacy program. Someone who shares our passion for tackling privacy complexities head-on, to help design and build continuous operational compliance practices at massive scale while representing our users and their privacy at the forefront of everything that we do.In this role, you will create and improve company-wide operational processes to establish, measure and improve privacy practices, compliance measures, execute testing and report on the state of compliance. This role will be a trusted partner to product, business, legal and engineering teams across the company to develop deep insights and drive improvements into the mechanics of how teams incorporate compliance and privacy-by-design into operations and product life cycles.











Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Front Financial is looking for an experienced Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) to join our team. This position develops, implements, and manages a comprehensive annual compliance work plan to ensure that financial and operational procedures and personal conduct comply with all applicable national and international laws, policies, and contractual agreements in a manner that supports the company and its operational areas.
The CCO reports directly to the Chief Executive Officer. She/He must also inform the Board about important issues and material violations.
CCO Duties and Responsibilities:
Design, implement and enforce company-wide compliance programs to ensure compliance with the company Code of Conduct and all applicable U.S. laws, rules, and regulations

FTE: 1.0, or 40 hours/week
Work Schedule and Location: Primarily Monday - Friday from 8 am to 5 pm; this position is located in and works out of Southern Oregon
Salary: $169,728 - $226,304/yr, based on qualifications and years of relevant experience
WHY ASANTE

Asante is more than a great hospital system in an amazing location. We are a community of passionate providers and service-focused caregivers who collaborate to deliver amazing patient outcomes; a place where titles don't matter as much as your creativity, drive, and passion. Our culture, values and people create an environment of sustained medical excellence. All three Asante hospitals have earned five stars from CMS for overall quality - the top rating given. In fact, Asante accounts for three of the five Oregon hospitals to achieve this rare honor.

Your Opportunity

Schwab Charitable is an independent public charity created to increase charitable giving in the United States by offering the flexible giving solution of a donor-advised fund (DAF) account. A donor-advised fund account is a simple, flexible, tax-smart investment account designed specifically for charitable purposes that offers clients and advisors a simple and streamlined way to contribute, invest and grant effectively. We are a leading national donor-advised fund provider—having granted out to over 190,000 charities nationwide since inception on behalf of our donors.

At Schwab Charitable, we believe people have an inherent desire to give and that investing and giving when done together can empower us to make a real difference in the world. We make it easy to integrate charitable giving into clients’ financial planning and wealth management conversations. We believe that if our clients apply the same thoughtful strategy to their giving and philanthropy that they apply to their finances and investments, they will be happier and more fulfilled donors. With our uniquely integrated approach, our simple and tax-smart giving solution, our access to online resources and our team of charitable specialists, we offer the tools, guidance and relationships to help donors give more to the charities that matter most to them.

As an Adapter, you will be surrounded by driven colleagues who think boldly to pursue ground-breaking innovation. You will experience meaningful challenge in your work and be fueled by motivating energy knowing you make a difference in people's lives.
You belong here- come discover your story at Adaptive.
